results.title: Silks and Saddles (1921)
results.brief_description: This film is firmly within the genre of racecourse melodrama. On the prosperous stud farm of Kangarooie, the squatter’s daughter, Bobbie, is torn between rival suitors whilst her weak-willed brother is embroiled with racketeers and a high society vamp. After much complex criminal activity in the stables before the big race the heroine herself rides her horse to victory.

results.title: Silk stockings
results.creator_credit: Arthur Freed, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Arthur Freed Productions and Rouben Mamoulian
results.brief_description: In this exuberant song and dance remake of Lubitsch’s ‘Ninotchka’, Fred Astaire and Cyd Charisse team up as the leading couple. Ninotchka, a stern lady Communist (Charisse) comes to Paris to retrieve three wayward comrades (Peter Lorre, Jules Munshin, Joseph Buloff) and a Russian composer (George Tobias). Much to her surprise, she is seduced by the trappings of capitalism in the form of champagne, silk stockings and a suave American producer (Fred Astaire), all of which contradict her Communist sensibilities. Includes songs such as: “Fated to be mated”, “All of you”, “The Ritz Rock and Roll”, “Silk stockings”, “Red blues”, “Josephine” and “Stereophonic sound”. Music and lyrics by Cole Porter. Screenplay by Leonard Gershe and Leonard Spigelgass.

results.title: Silk screen techniques
results.creator_credit: Bailey Film Productions and Durrell R. Crays
results.brief_description: Shows four advanced silk screen techniques, demonstrated by professional artists: the clay touche method, the glue touche process, the lacquer film technique, and the photo film technique.

results.title: Silk screen printing
results.creator_credit: Harry A Kapit and Josef Bohmer
results.brief_description: An introduction to silk screen printing, using ordinary paints and paper. Although the film does not deal with the use of dyes and the process of printing on fabrics, it covers adequately the more elementary uses of the process, showing the cutting of the stencil (a lacquer stencil), the removal of the top layer, fitting the stencil to the screen, and drying the finished prints - in this case Christmas and greeting cards.

results.title: Silk screen fundamentals
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Durrell R. Crays
results.brief_description: Outlines procedures involved in constructing a ‘do-it-yourself’ stretcher frame, stretching the commercial frame, cutting paper stencils, registering the printing stock, and printing the stencils. Shos tools used in silk screen art, with emphasis on care and safety.

results.title: Silk Moth
results.brief_description: Revelas the egg-laying process of the silk moth and shows the caterpillars as they emerge from the egg. Follows the process of metamorphosis from the spinning of the cocoon to the chrysalis stage and emergence of the silk moth. No narration.

results.title: Silk dreams
results.brief_description: Tung is Vietnamese - a refugee and a teenager. He lives in the western suburbs of Sydney. The rest of his family, apart from his grandmother, are still in Vietnam. He drifts along in an alien Western environment, hanging out with a gang of young men from a similar background until his grandmother, herself disadvantaged and displaced in Australia, spurs him on to change his life. An eye-opening and realistic drama of cultural isolation in contemporary Australia.

results.title: Silk and strings: a tale of Taiwan
results.creator_credit: Seabourne Enterprises and Bay Street Pictures Inc
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”.
Presents traditional aspects of Taiwanese culture. Contrasts the simple life, costumes, and art and crafts of the original natives of Taiwan with the culture of the Chinese. Focuses on the traditions of China as they are retained in Taiwan, including the cultivation of the arts, music, and calligraphy.

results.title: Silk
results.brief_description: Shows the production and use of silk as well as providing a history of silk, noting the life cycle of the silkworm and the spread of sericulture in Kenya. An excellent educational tool on the porduction of silk fabric from start to shelfs.

results.title: Silicon and its compounds
results.brief_description: Presents basic chemical facts about silicon, showing its sturcture and analysing its place in the periodic table. Long used by man in making glass and in building materials, silicon compounds display a wide variety of properties which are providing an ever-increasing source of materials, sich as lubricants, paints, polishes, silicone plastics and rubber.
